text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with homemade chipotle oil that's
right not only is this a beautiful and
very useful chili oil this would also
make a wonderful homemade holiday gift
and don't forget our mantra for homemade
gifts you're not cheap you're creative
alright so let's get started this could
not be easier in some kind of heat proof
Bowl we're gonna add two tablespoons of
ground chipotle pepper this is made from
jalapeno peppers that are smoked dried
and ground into a powder alright next
we're gonna go over to the stove and in
a small saucepan I'm gonna pour in two
cups of a neutral vegetable oil pretty
much anything will work you just don't
want something like olive oil or walnut
oil or something that's flavored I'm
using canola oil here we're gonna put
that on medium heat and we're gonna
bring that up to about 160 165 something
like that alright we don't want it super
hot we don't really want to cook the
spice but we do want it very warm so it
draws out a lot of the flavor and even
more importantly that beautiful
beautiful color so you're simply gonna
stir that in whisk it in really really
well and I know you're gonna ask will
this work with other spices I can't
stand chip au lait I would never give
this to my worst enemy I guess any spice
would really work here that would impart
a flavor and a color things like curry
powders tumeric smoked paprika things
like that would work so what we're gonna
do is we're gonna cover this with
aluminum foil and then just set it in a
nice safe place where it's not gonna get
knocked over alright doesn't need to be
hot doesn't need to be a cold spot just
room temperature anywhere some backroom
and leave it for a week or you can do
this in as little as a day and it will
flavor and color the oil just not as
well so if you really don't care about
the person you're giving this to and
you're just going through the motions a
day is fine but if you want it to come
out really nice leave it for like a week
alright and that's really it it is quite
quite simple to make okay so before we
bottle it of course we're gonna strain
it I'm gonna just use a very very fine
sieve alright one of these wire mesh
type works very well yes a little bit of
that powder is gonna go through I think
for me it adds
little extra spice of course the
trade-off is it's going to settle and
you're going to get a little bit of that
chipotle spice at the bottom of the
bottle if you want this extra fancy and
extra fine you could put it through a
coffee filter which is of course gonna
take longer to drain but it will come
out clearer now to package this if
you're just using this around your
kitchen to cook eggs or fry potatoes
then you could store it in anything that
has a tight-fitting lid but if you're
gonna give this as a gift you're gonna
want to get some of these cute little
bottle things with the old-fashioned
stopper topper and then I'm simply gonna
pour that in I strained it as you can
see into this glass measuring cup so it
would be easy to pour and that is it
look at that amazing color so cool and
this just doesn't look good it really
does taste good you can use this so many
ways you can use this as a finishing oil
to just drizzle over meats after they're
cooked you can use it in salad dressings
you can use this to cook eggs just a
million-in-one uses so if there's
someone in your family that likes spicy
likes chilies this would make a great
great gift and of course you could jump
